Data Types List
Here are the data types with brief descriptions:
advectionModule orchestrating the advection scheme. The main routine in the module is advection()
bed_loadContains different relations of bedload transport
boundary_advectionBoundary advection interface to be fulfilled by driver or application
boundary_advection::boundary_advective_flux_ifCalculate boundary advection
single_channel_boundary::boundary_data_ifProvide data for boundary
boundary_diffusionBoundary diffusive flux interface to be fulfilled by driver or application
boundary_diffusion_matrix_moduleBoundary diffusive matrix interface to be fulfilled by driver or application
boundary_diffusion::boundary_diffusive_flux_ifCalculate boundary diffusion flux
boundary_diffusion_matrix_module::boundary_diffusive_matrix_ifCalculate boundary diffusion matrix
boundary_diffusion::boundary_diffusive_matrix_ifGeneric interface for calculating BC of matrix that should be fulfilled by the driver or the client programs
callback
diffusionModule orchestrating the diffusion scheme. The main routine in the module is diffuse(). Explicit and implicit diffusion operators are included here
dispersion_coefficient::diffusion_coef_if
dispersion_coefficientDispersion coefficient interface to be fulfilled by driver or application
error_handlingRoutine sends the error message to logging routine
gaussian_init_boundary_conditionInitial conditions for examples It can fill an array with 1D Gaussin function, rectangular, and triangular, and also it can fill discontinuities. In case of multi-constituents tehy have to initialize separately
gradientModule containing routines for calculating differences and limiters
hydro_dataHydrodynamics interface to be fulfilled by driver or application
hydro_data::hydro_data_ifGeneric interface for fetching hydrodynamic data
hydro_uniform_flowInterfaces for user to provide flow and area. Replaces the connectivity with HYDRO at this point
loggingRoutines for bookkeeping and print out the logs
matrix_solverMatrix solver module for the system of linear equations. The solvers include:
mostly_variablesExample module (in the fortran sense) containing global variables. Might also define functions to allocate them. [please expand for style comments]
Multiply
non_cohesive_sourceRoutines provide the calculation for non-cohesive suspended sediment erosion and deposition functions. The functions in this module are: 1. Garcia and Parker (1991) 2. van Rijn (1984b) 3. Smith and McLean (1977) 4. Zyserman and Fredsoe (1994) for more details see ASCE manual #110 page 117
only_subroutinesExample module containing routines for calculating things
primitive_variable_conversionModule containing routines for converting mass to concentraion, and concentration to mass
logging::printout
reactionModule orchestrating the reaction scheme. The main routine in the module is react()
suspended_sediment_variable::sediment_hydro_ifGeneric interface for fetching hydrodynamic data (
sediment_variablesDefines the input variables for the sediment transport sources. This replaces the notion of "rough I/O" suggested by Jamie Anderson originally. The module defines the basic parameters for the sediment transport sources based on the table agreed on 2/11/2011
single_channel_boundaryBoundary conditions for a single channel
source_sink::source_ifCalculate source
source_sinkSource interface to be fulfilled by driver or application Specifically, the user must set the "source" pointer (a variable in this module) to a subroutine that meets the compute_source interface
state_variablesDefines state variables for the transport problem as well as functions to allocate them
stm_precisionDefinition of model precision, precision-related constants and special values
suspended_sediment_variableHydrodynamics interface to provide depth and flow velocity to be fed by user
suspended_utilityRoutines provide the general calculation for suspended sediment sinks/sources routines. All the constant based drived variables are here !:
test_advection_reaction_tidalTesting advection of mass which is subjected to a tidal boundary
test_bed_loadTests for the bed-load formula related subroutines
test_boundary_diffusionTodo: write tests for boundary diffusive flux subroutine Tests boundary diffusive flux pointer
test_coarseningTests the coarsening subroutine
test_cohesiveTests the suspended cohesive sediment subroutines
test_construct_r_h_sTodo: write tests for construct right hand side subroutine before imposing Boundary Conditions Tests the interior elemets of right hand side F (KU=F)
test_convergence_transportGeneric convergence test with advection, diffusion and source terms
test_convergence_transport_uniformTest advection diffusion and reaction in a single channel with uniform flow
test_diffusion_fletcherTodo: write tests for diffusion subroutine in case of Neumann BC at the left and Dirichlet BC at the right sideTest of transport diffusion convergence test for a single channel
test_diffusion_nonlinear_decayTodo: write tests for diffusion subroutine in case of Neumann BC at the left and Dirichlet BC at the right sideTest of transport convergence diffusion subjected to cubic decay for a single channel
test_diffusive_fluxWrite tests for interior diffusive flux sobroutine
test_explicit_diffusion_operatorUnit test for explicit diffusion operator subroutine
test_extrapolateTesting of the extrapolate step
test_gradientTest module for gradients and limiters
test_hydroTesting the subroutine which provides the hydrodynamics of the tidal flow
test_interior_coef_matrixTest for interior lines of diffusion coefficient matrix
test_matrix_solverTests for matrix solver
test_mms_advection_dispersionTesting advection and diffusion with spacially and temporally variable coefficents vs. analytical solution The source term here is derived based on MMS
test_non_cohesiveTests the suspended non cohesive sediment subroutines
test_prim_cons_conversionTesting of primitive-conservative conversion
test_prim_increment_to_consTest for subroutine primitive increment to conservative
test_sediment_hydro_dataTests the suspended special and temporal variable data interface
test_time_dependent_advection_dispersionTesting advection and diffusion with temporal variable coefficents vs. analytical solution
test_uniform_flowTest of mass transport convergence in uniform flow that switches direction The purpose of this test is to check for some issues involving symmetry
test_utilityRoutines for grid refinement/coarsening operations
test_zoppou_advection_dispersionTesting advection and diffusion with spacially variable coefficents vs. analytical solution
